page.title: 01IRVINE NEW TOWN S.E. AREA
page.content: { Dreghorn,}our village, is situated near the south west coast of Scotland. It is part of{Irvine New Town,}the only coastal new town in Britain. Irvine was designated a new town site in 1966. {The land}in our area is mainly flat with a few small hills.There are two rivers flowing through the area, the {Irvine}and its tributary the{Annick.} These rivers join together just outside the town of Irvine, and flow through the town to join the sea in the{Firth of Clyde. As the new town has grown since 1966, the population has increased from thirty thousand to around sixty thousand. New houses have been built all around Dreghorn, as have new {industrial estates.}Recently, however, many of the factories have closed, creating many unemployed.
